title: ASRC Industrial Services Acquires Mavo Systems
text:
Minnesota-based Environmental and Specialty Contractor to join AIS’s growing industrial services platform
CONCORD, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- ASRC Industrial Services (“AIS”), a premier provider of industrial and environmental services throughout the Continental United States, is pleased to announce the acquisition of Mavo Systems (“Mavo”), a White Bear Lake, Minnesota-based Environmental and Specialty Services Contractor. Mavo will become the foundation of AIS’s Remediation and Response operating group.
Mavo, founded in 1982, is recognized as a premier value-added, environmental and specialty services contractor with operations throughout the upper Midwest. The company specializes in asbestos, lead and mold abatement, demolition, insulation and emergency response and restoration services. They serve multiple end markets including: manufacturing, higher education, healthcare and power generation.
“I am pleased to welcome the talented workforce of Mavo to the AIS family of companies,” said Greg Johnson, president/CEO of AIS. “The acquisition of Mavo is a critical step in AIS’s journey to building an enduring, customer-centric, value-added service provider focused on the industrial market complex.”
“Today is an exciting day for employees and customers of Mavo,” said Jay Robertson, Mavo President and former shareholder. “Selling a business is always a tough decision, especially when factoring in the impact on employees and customers. However, I am confident that AIS is the right ‘home’ for Mavo and becoming a part of the AIS family will provide additional opportunities for our employees and expanded services to current, as well as new customers.”
About ASRC Industrial Services
Headquartered in Concord, California, ASRC Industrial Services (“AIS”) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Arctic Slope Regional Corporation (“ASRC”). AIS is organized within three capabilities-based operating groups: Construction, Maintenance and Repair; Remediation and Response Services; and Environmental Engineering and Professional Services. AIS has more than 1,850 employees and operations throughout the Continental United States. AIS subsidiaries include Petrochem, RSI Entech, DACA Specialty Services, D2 Industrial Services, US Coatings and AIS Response Services. As a wholly owned subsidiary of ASRC, AIS and its subsidiaries are considered minority business enterprises. Learn more about AIS at www.asrcindustrial.com .
